location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged chronologically from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: The foliation system in use is the sequence of numbers appearing in a circle in the top right hand corner of each folio. The file also bears a former foliation system comprising of uncircled numbers beginning at 51 (folio 2) and ending at 182 (folio 24).

mods.abstract: Correspondence mainly relating to the collection of finances. Non-payment by certain tribes on the Batinah Coast is identified as a threat to the revenue of the Muscat State and the visit of a sloop or flying boat to these regions is recommended. Correspondents include the Political Agent, Muscat; Captain Reginal George Alban, the Financial Adviser, Muscat State; the Political Resident, Persian Gulf. One letter describes the Sultan's tour of the Batinah coast.
